findings.title: Outdated Compiler Version
findings.description: Using an outdated compiler version can be problematic especially if there are publicly disclosed bugs and issues that affect the current compiler version.

findings.title: Floating Pragma
findings.description: Contracts should be deployed with the same compiler version and flags that they have been tested thoroughly. Locking the pragma helps to ensure that contracts do not accidentally get deployed using, for example, an outdated compiler version that might introduce bugs that affect the contract system negatively.

findings.title: Using approve function of the token standard
findings.description: The approve function of ERC-20 is vulnerable to front-running attacks, allowing an attacker to spend approved tokens before the change of allowance value.

findings.title: Literals with too many digits
findings.description: Using literals with excessive digits can lead to precision loss and potential security issues.
